botanical_details.potentially_harmful: Skin irritant. Wear gloves and other protective equipment when handling
botanical_details.genus: Hydrangea can be deciduous or evergreen shrubs, or self-clinging climbers, with flowers in clusters usually comprising both small fertile and more showy sterile flowers; often good autumn colour

how_to_grow.cultivation: Grow in moist but well-drained soil in sun or partial shade. See shrubby hydrangea cultivation for more detailed advice
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by softwood cuttings in early summer or hardwood cuttings in winter
how_to_grow.pruning: Pruning group 1 or, to obtain larger flowerheads, cut back previous season's shoots to within a few buds of the woody framework in spring
how_to_grow.pests: Aphids, capsid bug, hydrangea scale and vine weevil may be a problem
how_to_grow.diseases: May be subject to a leaf spot, grey moulds, powdery mildews and honey fungus
